topic.title: Error Message
topic.body:
PluginManager Plugin AnnounceBitTorrent load error: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'bencode_open' in PluginManager.py line 138 > AnnounceBitTorrent/__init__.py line 1 > AnnounceBitTorrent/AnnounceBitTorrentPlugin.py line 6

i run ubuntu and zeronet installed via snap

any ideas

topic.title: IPv6 with Yggdrasil
topic.body:
Got ipv6 listening on port 15441 and enabled ipv6 interface with address in the config but no connections are getting through between 2 peers.
I also added them with their zero:// url as trackers on both sides
Nmap confirmed that the ports are open.
Any ideas ?

topic.title: Looking for yggdrasil ZN nodes
topic.body:
If you run a ZN node with working IPv6 via yggdrasil - drop me a line in here.
Cheers

topic.title: ZN connectivity across networks
topic.body:
How does ZN deal with different 'networks'
If my ZN has clearnet + tor + yggdrasil.
I assume that ipv4 trackers only register share ipv4 capable nodes ?
tor peer reachability is not the same as tor tracker connection i presume ?
Cheers

topic.title: ZN Trackers
topic.body:
How many trackers can I add to zeronet.
Does my ZN keep adding new trackers on its own ?
Is there a limit or algorithm to avoid network partitioning ?

topic.title: ZN onion url
topic.body:
So i have ZN with local tor running . 
Where do i find the .onion ZN generates ?

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: Testing ZN via yggdrasil via TOR -> 201:6337:7f71:aeba:8277:fec7:bd62:fe27:15441

1578976152_17FotRRc6msHBzM2jrs6tQCmpLaXi.body:
> [lianna](#comment_106_16ePf6TBgip2eF88AxhnRJdPXyZJK1V2S4): Looks like a missing Python module. [...]

tried but not working - maybe due to being a snap install ?

> [gitcenter](#comment_1214_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): @lianna It should be bencode_open, not bencode. [...]

I did that - same error

1580575907_17FotRRc6msHBzM2jrs6tQCmpLaXi.body:
I fixed it by adjusting my config:

fileserver_ip_type = ipv6
ip_external = 
 204:d3d4:d074:7772:75bd:d1a0:8f0b:bbb2
fileserver_ip =
 204:d3d4:d074:7772:75bd:d1a0:8f0b:bbb2


now in and outgoing ipv6 is working

thanx

> [mg0](#comment_228_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): if you want to connect to a peer directly for let's say getting a zite updated from the local version of that peer or just reaching more connectivity with it, you can open a zite adding /?zeronet_peers=<address of your peers separated by comma>. You can see an example by pulling zeronet sidebar and clicking the copy to clipboard link. it will paste the current zite you are visiting and append a list of peers you are already connected to, then you can append the link of your desired peer to it and open that URL. [...]

just fixed it 

thanx

> [dude](#comment_21_1APx2pf1wNGFz4mWCN2sFzrtTGzrLKZUQ2): is it working now with ipv4?

yes it is working with ipv4 and ipv6 now.

1580640062_141cDEZpTXUnEtreAL9ELWzcNqdNt.body: My ZN node is reachable via 204:d3d4:d074:7772:75bd:d1a0:8f0b:bbb2 port 15441.

1572739729_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
Not a thing.
The only thing that still bothers me is human stupidity.
;-)

1581265040_17FotRRc6msHBzM2jrs6tQCmpLaXi.body:
Furthermore the tor .onion is V2 and it changes on every ZN restart.
That is not ideal ....
